text: Norman Lamm (December 19, 1927 â€“ May 31, 2020) was an American Modern Orthodox rabbi, scholar, author and Jewish communal leader. He was the Chancellor of Yeshiva University until his retirement on July 1, 2013. He was born in New York City. In 1958 Lamm helped found Tradition, an academic journal of Modern Orthodox thought. He also launched the Torah U-Madda Journal. Lamm died on May 31, 2020 in Englewood, New Jersey at the age of 92.Rabbi Norman Lamm, former Yeshiva U president, dies at 92 ==References== ==Other websites== * Yeshiva University: The Lamm Heritage *Yeshiva University: Rabbi Isaac Elchanan Theological Seminary - Rabbi Norman Lamm Kollel (Yadin Yadin) *Lamm and controversy over gays at YU schools (1995) *Lamm's Eulogy for Israeli PM Yitzhak Rabin (1995) Category:1927 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American rabbis Category:Educators from New York City Category:Jewish American writers Category:Writers from New York City
title: Norman Lamm
